alert.note: Alert for Calabasas and Agoura Hills; Central Ventura County Valleys; Eastern San Fernando Valley; Malibu Coast; Santa Clarita Valley; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Western San Fernando Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 08 at 9:28AM PST until November 09 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM THURSDAY FOR MOST MOUNTAIN AND VALLEY AREAS OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES AS WELL AS THE MALIBU COAST DUE TO GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Gusty Santa Ana winds and low humidities will impact portions of Los Angeles and Ventura counties through Thursday. The current north to northeast winds will shift to more northeasterly and peak later tonight into Thursday morning, then gradually decrease Thursday afternoon through Friday. Humidity levels will gradually lower as well. As a result, the chance of reaching six or more hours of low humidity and gusty wind combinations is 20 percent for today but 70 percent for tonight through Thursday. The previous Fire Weather Watch has therefore been upgraded to a Red Flag Warning for the same time period and areas. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM PST THURSDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WIND PRONE VALLEYS OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES AS WELL AS THE MALIBU COAST... The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 3 AM to 6 PM PST Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * WINDS...North to northeast winds 15 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. Isolated gusts to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Falling to 8 to 15 percent by Thursday. Poor humidity recovery between 15 and 30 percent across the wind prone valleys and hills. * Impacts...If fire ignition occurs there could be rapid spread of wildfire that would lead to a threat to life and property.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. Use extreme caution with anything that can spark a wildfire. Residents near wildland interfaces should be prepared to evacuate if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information.
